title: Let data_source field_parameters override the defaults in a ProjectionPlot

content.raw: I think you should use `field_parameters.update()` instead of just copying the `field_parameters` from the `data_source`.  That way you can still specify additional `field_parameters` that aren't defined on the `data_source` by passing in a `field_parameters` dict.
content.html: I think you should use field_parameters.update() instead of just copying the field_parameters from the data_source. That way you can still specify additional field_parameters that aren't defined on the data_source by passing in a field_parameters dict.

content.raw:
I'm hesitant on this.  The reason for that is the `center` parameter, which often is differently set for the source and the destination.

Additionally, this may be the only place we *modify* field parameters, rather than swap them out.  I would rather not set that precedent.
content.html:
I'm hesitant on this. The reason for that is the center parameter, which often is differently set for the source and the destination.

Additionally, this may be the only place we modify field parameters, rather than swap them out. I would rather not set that precedent.

pullrequest.title: Let data_source field_parameters override the defaults in a ProjectionPlot

content.raw: Well, I can make it so center isn't overwritten, but I think this makes more sense than the previous default.  Using a data_source, one expects to use the bulk_velocity from that data_source, instead of having to expressly set it as a dictionary kwarg in the ProjectionPlot constructor.  The fact that the ProjectionPlot *defaults* to setting this field_parameter (and other field_parameters like "center" and "normal" to 0 seems like a mistake to me.
content.html: Well, I can make it so center isn't overwritten, but I think this makes more sense than the previous default. Using a data_source, one expects to use the bulk_velocity from that data_source, instead of having to expressly set it as a dictionary kwarg in the ProjectionPlot constructor. The fact that the ProjectionPlot defaults to setting this field_parameter (and other field_parameters like "center" and "normal" to 0 seems like a mistake to me.

pullrequest.title: Let data_source field_parameters override the defaults in a ProjectionPlot

content.raw: While I didn't see this PR, I did see this code when identifying my problem.  Basically this just makes it so the source will overwrite field param that aren't set by the Projection, but since the Projection gets a default ``bulk_velocity`` of 0, it won't be overwritten.  I might even go so far as to say that new objects (at least projections) should not get field parameters set to 0 by default at instantiation (as is currently the case for the ``center``, ``normal``, and ``bulk_velocity`` field parameters).  If that were true, then John's PR would've fixed my problem, but since the ProjectionPlot automatically gets a ``bulk_velocity`` set to 0, it won't normally be overwritten by the data_source, so I have to do it explicitly, which is what this PR is addressing.
content.html: While I didn't see this PR, I did see this code when identifying my problem. Basically this just makes it so the source will overwrite field param that aren't set by the Projection, but since the Projection gets a default bulk_velocity of 0, it won't be overwritten. I might even go so far as to say that new objects (at least projections) should not get field parameters set to 0 by default at instantiation (as is currently the case for the center, normal, and bulk_velocity field parameters). If that were true, then John's PR would've fixed my problem, but since the ProjectionPlot automatically gets a bulk_velocity set to 0, it won't normally be overwritten by the data_source, so I have to do it explicitly, which is what this PR is addressing.

pullrequest.title: Let data_source field_parameters override the defaults in a ProjectionPlot

content.raw:
One of the reasons I am very reluctant to allow this is because of the priority of the objects.  I believe that the *last* created object should take precedence; in this instance, it will be the projection.  As an example, I may create a data source about which I want to vary some parameter -- I have seen this in passing field parameters as cuts or local velocity measures during HI simulated observations.  The simplest way to do this is to take multiple projections, where the `field_parameters` are varied.

The solution here addresses, but only as a side effect, the default parameters.  Additionally, we have mechanisms like `restore_field_information_state` that prevent the objects from being overwritten.  As it currently stands, this breaks priority of objects, it only has the side effect of addressing the issue of defaults, and unfortunately it also overwrites field parameters for `data_source` objects.

I think part of the reason that I am reluctant to change the behavior is because of the philosophy of how data objects work -- the data source itself does not contain the data, the projection does.  So the projection should have priority over the data object's parameters, since the field is generated there.

The change to the default parameters is a separate issue, however, but one that I think is not necessarily solvable in this way.  One option would be to have a "clean" or "dirty" bit for which field parameters have been modified to their default values, and which have not.  Then, only the "dirty" values would override, rather than the "clean" values.
content.html:
One of the reasons I am very reluctant to allow this is because of the priority of the objects. I believe that the last created object should take precedence; in this instance, it will be the projection. As an example, I may create a data source about which I want to vary some parameter -- I have seen this in passing field parameters as cuts or local velocity measures during HI simulated observations. The simplest way to do this is to take multiple projections, where the field_parameters are varied.

The solution here addresses, but only as a side effect, the default parameters. Additionally, we have mechanisms like restore_field_information_state that prevent the objects from being overwritten. As it currently stands, this breaks priority of objects, it only has the side effect of addressing the issue of defaults, and unfortunately it also overwrites field parameters for data_source objects.

I think part of the reason that I am reluctant to change the behavior is because of the philosophy of how data objects work -- the data source itself does not contain the data, the projection does. So the projection should have priority over the data object's parameters, since the field is generated there.

The change to the default parameters is a separate issue, however, but one that I think is not necessarily solvable in this way. One option would be to have a "clean" or "dirty" bit for which field parameters have been modified to their default values, and which have not. Then, only the "dirty" values would override, rather than the "clean" values.

pullrequest.title: Let data_source field_parameters override the defaults in a ProjectionPlot

content.raw: I'm OK not accepting this PR, but I think something needs to be done about the defaults.  Is there a use-case when you would want the default ``bulk_velocity`` to be set to 0?  It seems like ``bulk_velocity`` is mostly set up to deal with radial velocities, and I don't think anyone is trying to calculate radial velocities when the bulk_velocity is set to 0.  If we prevent ``bulk_velocity`` from being set to 0 by default, this solves my problem, and I think it also makes things more intuitive.
content.html: I'm OK not accepting this PR, but I think something needs to be done about the defaults. Is there a use-case when you would want the default bulk_velocity to be set to 0? It seems like bulk_velocity is mostly set up to deal with radial velocities, and I don't think anyone is trying to calculate radial velocities when the bulk_velocity is set to 0. If we prevent bulk_velocity from being set to 0 by default, this solves my problem, and I think it also makes things more intuitive.

content.raw: I am open to this as a solution.  There are places that do not recognize `bulk_velocity` will be None, which will all need to be fixed; I have found at least one.
content.html: I am open to this as a solution. There are places that do not recognize bulk_velocity will be None, which will all need to be fixed; I have found at least one.

pullrequest.title: Let data_source field_parameters override the defaults in a ProjectionPlot

content.raw:
For what it's worth, I think the current behavior is pretty unintuitive - I would expect the projection to inherit field parameters from the data source.  In fact, that is the current behavior in yt, except (as cameron pointed out above) for `normal`, `center`, and `bulk_velocity`.

An alternate fix would be to change the following code in `_initialize_source` on line 1775 of `data_containers.py` from the following:


```
#!python

            for k, v in source.field_parameters.items():                        
                if k not in self.field_parameters:                              
                    self.set_field_parameter(k,v)                               
```

to:


```
#!python

           for k, v in source.field_parameters.items():                                                    
               self.set_field_parameter(k,v)                       
```

or alternatively:

```
#!python

           for k, v in source.field_parameters.items():
               if k not in self.field_parameters or is_default(self.field_parameters[k])                                                    
                   self.set_field_parameter(k,v)                       
```

So that the defaults can be overrided, which is impossible with the way this is currently set up.  Here, `is_default` would be a function that checks if the value is one of the defaults set in `__set_default_field_parameters`.
content.html:
For what it's worth, I think the current behavior is pretty unintuitive - I would expect the projection to inherit field parameters from the data source. In fact, that is the current behavior in yt, except (as cameron pointed out above) for normal, center, and bulk_velocity.

An alternate fix would be to change the following code in _initialize_source on line 1775 of data_containers.py from the following:

            for k, v in source.field_parameters.items():                        
                if k not in self.field_parameters:                              
                    self.set_field_parameter(k,v)

to:

           for k, v in source.field_parameters.items():                                                    
               self.set_field_parameter(k,v)

or alternatively:

           for k, v in source.field_parameters.items():
               if k not in self.field_parameters or is_default(self.field_parameters[k])                                                    
                   self.set_field_parameter(k,v)

So that the defaults can be overrided, which is impossible with the way this is currently set up. Here, is_default would be a function that checks if the value is one of the defaults set in __set_default_field_parameters.

pullrequest.title: Let data_source field_parameters override the defaults in a ProjectionPlot

reason: Alternative solution proposed and will be PR'd.
description:
Field parameters like "bulk_velocity" were being ignored from the data_source, when one tried to take a ProjectionPlot using that data_source.  This seems more intuitive to allow the data_source's own field parameters to override.  N.B. this also allows the data_source's "center" field_parameter to override the one specified in the ProjectionPlot constructor--as that seemed the most consistent and intuitive, but I'm open to feedback on this.

UPDATE1: Modifying to use the dictionary.update() function so I don't clobber any field_params already set in the ProjectionPlot unrelated to the data_source.  Thanks, @ngoldbaum !
